description: Master the JUnit 5 framework for professional Java unit testing

slides.title: Introduction to JUnit 5
slides.content:
# JUnit 5 â˜•

The standard for testing in the Java ecosystem (JUnit Platform + Jupiter + Vintage).

- **@Test**: Mark a method as a test.
- **Assertions**: Highly readable checks.
- **Parameterized**: Run tests with varied inputs.
- **Extensions**: Powerful modular architecture.

slides.title: Basic Annotations
slides.content:
# Core Annotations ğŸ·ï¸

| Annotation | Purpose |
|------------|---------|
| `@Test` | Marks a test method |
| `@BeforeEach` | Runs before every test |
| `@AfterEach` | Runs after every test |
| `@BeforeAll` | Static; runs once before all |
| `@AfterAll` | Static; runs once after all |

slides.title: A Simple Test
Common Assertions
slides.content:
# Assertions ğŸ“¢

`Assertions` class contains static methods:

- `assertEquals(expected, actual)`
- `assertTrue(condition)`
- `assertNotNull(object)`
- `assertArrayEquals(expectedArr, actualArr)`
- `assertAll(executable...)`: Group assertions.

slides.title: Display Names
Testing Exceptions
Assertions Groups
slides.content:
# assertAll ğŸ“¦

Run multiple assertions; even if the first fails, the others are checked.

```java
assertAll("user checks",
    () -> assertEquals("John", user.getFirstName()),
    () -> assertEquals("Doe", user.getLastName())
);
```

slides.title: Assumptions
slides.content:
# Assumptions ğŸš§

Only run tests if certain conditions are met.

```java
Assumptions.assumeTrue(
    "DEV".equals(System.getenv("ENV")),
    "Skipping test; not in DEV environment"
);
```
